sentence: Williams-Sonoma, Inc.WSM is set to report first-quarter fiscal 2015 results on May 20, after the markets close.
Last quarter, it posted a positive surprise of 0.66%.
Let's see how things are shaping up for this announcement.

This leading specialty retailer of home furnishing products reported impressive top and bottom line results in fiscal 2014 driven by solid growth across all brands and channels, particularly the e-commerce business.
These trends are expected to benefit first quarter results as well.
However, challenges related to disruptions in the West Coast ports, which hurt fourth quarter results, are expected to continue in the upcoming quarter.
Williams-Sonoma expects earnings per share for the first quarter of 2015 in the range of 40 cents to 45 cents, lower than 48 cents in the prior year quarter.
The company expects net revenue in the range of $990 million to $1.01 billion, compared with $974 million in the first quarter 2014.
However, comparable brand revenues are expected to increase in the range of 2% to 4% during the quarter, which is much lower than 10% growth rate in the prior year quarter.
Our proven model does not conclusively show that Williams-Sonoma is likely to beat earnings this quarter.
That is because a stock needs to have both a positive Earnings ESP and a Zacks Rank of #1, 2 or 3 for this to happen.
That is not the case here, as you will see below.
Zacks ESP: The Earnings ESP is -9.09% as the Most Accurate estimate stands at 40 cents while the Zacks Consensus Estimate is higher at 44 cents.
Zacks Rank #3 (Hold): Williams-Sonoma Zacks Rank #3 increases the predictive power of ESP.
However, we need to have a positive ESP to be confident about an earnings surprise.
We caution against stocks with Zacks Rank #4 and 5 (Sell-rated stocks) going into the earnings announcement, especially when the company is seeing negative estimate revisions momentum.

Here are some companies in retail wholesale sector that can be considered as our model shows that they have the right combination of elements to post an earnings beat this quarter:

J. C. Penney Company, Inc. JCP with Earnings ESP of +4.0% and a Zacks Rank #2

The Gap, Inc. GPS with an Earnings ESP of +1.82% and a Zacks Rank #3

The Home Depot, Inc. HD with an Earnings ESP of +0.87% and a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).
